title: Presidential transition of John F. Kennedy
added: [https://www.jfklibrary.org/asset-viewer/archives/JFKTRAN PAPERS OF JOHN F. KENNEDY. PRE-PRESIDENTIAL PAPERS. TRANSITION FILES] â€“[[John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum]]

title: Presidential transition of John F. Kennedy
added: During the transiton, outgoing President Eisenhower held two meetings with Kennedy, one on December 6 and another on January 19.<ref name="PSQ1"/> During both meeting, among other foreign policy topics such as [[Berlin]] (tensions between [[East Germany]] and [[West Germany]]) and the [[Far East]], they also discussed [[Cuba]], as the [[CIA]] was planning what would ultimately become the [[Bay of Pigs Invasion]].<ref name="PSQ1"/>

title: Presidential transition of John F. Kennedy
added: During the transiton, outgoing President Eisenhower held two meetings with Kennedy, one on December 6 and another on January 19.<ref name="PSQ1"/> During both meeting, among other foreign policy topics such as [[Berlin]] (tensions between [[East Germany]] and [[West Germany]]) and the [[Far East]], they also discussed [[Cuba]], as the [[CIA]] was planning what would ultimately become the [[Bay of Pigs Invasion]].<ref name="PSQ1"/> The same day as their first meeting, Eisenhower also hosted Kennedy for a meeting with members of the outgoing [[Cabinet of the United States|Cabinet]].<ref name="PSQ1"/>

title: Presidential transition of John F. Kennedy
added: After being elected, Kennedy received extensive briefings by the [[CIA]], including directly from [[Allen Dulles]] and [[Richard M. Bissell Jr.]]<ref name="PSQ1"/>

During the transiton, outgoing President Eisenhower held two meetings with Kennedy, one on December 6 and another on January 19.<ref name="PSQ1"/> During both meeting, among other foreign policy topics such as [[Berlin]] (tensions between [[East Germany]] and [[West Germany]]) and the [[Far East]], they also discussed [[Cuba]], as the CIA was planning what would ultimately become the [[Bay of Pigs Invasion]].<ref name="PSQ1"/> The same day as their first meeting, Eisenhower also hosted Kennedy for a meeting with members of the outgoing [[Cabinet of the United States|Cabinet]].<ref name="PSQ1"/>

title: Presidential transition of John F. Kennedy
added: After being elected, Kennedy received extensive briefings by the [[CIA]], including directly from [[Allen Dulles]] and [[Richard M. Bissell Jr.]]<ref name="PSQ1"/> He was briefed on covert plans against [[Fidel Castro]] of [[Cuba]], as the CIA was planning what would ultimately become the [[Bay of Pigs Invasion]].<ref name="PSQ1"/>

During the transiton, outgoing President Eisenhower held two meetings with Kennedy, one on December 6 and another on January 19.<ref name="PSQ1"/> During both meeting, among other foreign policy topics such as [[Berlin]] (tensions between [[East Germany]] and [[West Germany]]) and the [[Far East]], they discussed Cuba.<ref name="PSQ1"/> The same day as their first meeting, Eisenhower also hosted Kennedy for a meeting with members of the outgoing [[Cabinet of the United States|Cabinet]].<ref name="PSQ1"/>

title: Presidential transition of John F. Kennedy
added: After Nixon [[Concession (politics)|conceded]] the election on November 9, President Dwight D. Eisenhower sent president-elect Kennedy two [[telegrams]]. One of them to briefly congratulate the president-elect, and a second in which he promised to cooperate on an orderly transfer of power, and gave proposals on how to proceed with one.<ref>Shaw 2018 pp.126</ref>
